column3:
Asking a dumb but sincere question:  why?

These parameters are global and constant to main, the module being modified.  This change appears to add parameters for little apparent gain.

Is this an intermediate step to the code being moved to libconsensus?

Well, these are actually the methods that are not required for libconsensus but still use Consensus::Params.
This is part of a bigger process of making CChainParams being explicitly passed as a const reference instead of using the Params() function all around. Basically that function is a way to hide a global that @theuni and I want to take out of chainparams.

Passing it explicitly as a parame
@jonasschnelli 's nit solved, faster with the help of @dcousens .\n
Tested ACK (ran unit tests, did fiddle around with it in regtest).\nGitian build: https://builds.jonasschnelli.ch/pulls/6163/\n
Needs to fix https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/zmq/zmqpublishnotifier.cpp#L149 et al as well.\n
@MarcoFalke Yep, that's all I could see in travis, but I wanted to build src/zmq/zmqpublishnotifier.o locally before squashing. Squashing now...\n
Oops, lost in rebase.\nThanks @jonasschnelli @dcousens for the extremely fast and helpful review. I will force push this and #5970 with the fix. \n

I'm going to maintain chainparams instead of chainParams for uniformity across the codebase.\nWhen @theuni asked me #XXXX not to use "params" for both CChainParams and Consensus::Params I used "consensusParams" and "chainparams", but he meant "chainParams" (btw pow.cpp still uses "params" #5812, no big deal).\nNow I'm afraid is too late for chainParams, even if he used that in one of his improveme
Nit,  why did you opt for `chainparams` over `chainParams`?  camelCase is used consistently for most other variables. \n
Yep, but chainparams is used in more places than chainParams (my fault) so it seems too late. I explained this in more detail here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6163#discussion_r38074977\n
